column4: Hello, I am in the /dev folder trying to figure out how ubuntu sees the 4 usb ports on my dell laptop. I am trying to mount a usb to serial cable to a usb port so I can connect the console port of a cisco router - any guidance?
usb to serial?
just use screen
you don't mount anything
I'm assuming it's a PL2303 chipset
so just do screen /dev/ttyUSB0
this works because it sees the serial connection and uses it like a PTY
thank you for the pointers, I received a message "sorry could not find a pty"
sudo
or add yourself to the proper group
awesome! thank you. I am going through the linux command line publication and just got to the permissions portion. This was sort of an emergency thing, you are the best
np!
you can also use minicom or gtkterm
but screen is just so nice and easy ;)
on a sidenote, I'm just learning linux and how the kernal works. I'm running bohdi which is ubuntu based and I have a generic VBox with an XP client.
but the Vbox doesn't recognize any of my usb ports
install the extras package
yeah, I am astonished at how awesome screen is
it's proprietary crap in my opinion
kvm is nice too ;)
well I don't even need it now that you've shared screen
you meant VBox is proprietary junk right?
